sections.title: Understanding AI Opponents
sections.content: Your AI opponent has a distinct personality that shapes their strategy throughout the game. Learning to recognize and counter each personality type gives you a significant advantage.

subsections.title: Commander Kratos (Aggressive)
subsections.content: Commander Kratos believes in strength through conquest. This AI prioritizes military development over economy and attacks early and often. Expect constant pressure from Turn 5 onwards.
subsections.quote: Strength through conquest! Your planets will fall.

counterStrategy: Build Orbital Defense early on vulnerable planets
Maintain a defensive fleet near likely attack targets
Exploit their weak economy—they neglect mining infrastructure
Their aggression creates opportunities when their attacks fail

subsections.tip: Kratos attacks before building a strong economy. If you survive the early assault, their staying power is limited.

subsections.title: Overseer Aegis (Defensive)
subsections.content: Overseer Aegis plays a patient, defensive game. They fortify their planets, build economic infrastructure, and rarely initiate attacks. Breaking their defenses requires overwhelming force.
subsections.quote: Patience is the strongest fortress. I can wait.

counterStrategy: Don't rush attacks—build superior force first
Use bombardment to soften defenses before assault
Target their least-defended planets for flanking
Their passivity lets you build unmolested—use that time

subsections.warning: Attacking Aegis without overwhelming superiority leads to costly failures. Be patient and build.

subsections.title: Magistrate Midas (Economic)
subsections.content: Magistrate Midas believes wealth is power. This AI builds extensive economic infrastructure before military expansion. They start slow but become dangerous if left unchecked.
subsections.quote: Credits are power. My wealth will crush you.

counterStrategy: Attack early before their economy compounds
Raid their Cargo Cruisers to disrupt trade
Don't let them colonize multiple planets
Time pressure is your ally—strike before Turn 15

subsections.tip: Midas is vulnerable in the first 10 turns. Strike early or face an economic juggernaut.

subsections.title: General Nexus (Balanced)
subsections.content: General Nexus adapts to the situation. Without strong biases, they respond tactically to your actions. This makes them unpredictable but also exploitable if you understand their decision patterns.

counterStrategy: Unpredictability works both ways—vary your approach
They react to threats, so feint attacks can draw resources
Watch for patterns in their responses
Standard solid play is effective—no special counters needed

sections.title: Difficulty Mechanics
sections.content: Difficulty settings affect AI behavior thresholds and strength calculations. Understanding these mechanics helps you choose the right challenge level.

subsections.title: Difficulty Effects
subsections.content: Higher difficulties don't give the AI better units—they make the AI bolder and more efficient. The AI assesses its strength differently and attacks with smaller advantages.
subsections.tip: On Hard difficulty, keep your military strength visible. The AI attacks when it thinks it's stronger—don't give it openings.

sections.title: Economic Optimization
sections.content: Efficient resource management separates novice players from experts. These techniques maximize your economic output and strategic flexibility.

subsections.title: Building Efficiency
subsections.content: Not all buildings provide equal value for their cost. Understanding cost-efficiency helps you prioritize construction.

analysis.payback: 40 turns to recover mineral cost, 33 turns for fuel

analysis.verdict: High cost but invaluable for key planets

subsections.tip: Mining Stations are expensive but compound over time. Build them early when their long payback period matters less.

subsections.title: Planet Specialization
subsections.content: Each planet type has production bonuses. Specializing planets based on their type maximizes output across your empire.

specializations.strategy: Stack Mining Stations, export minerals to other planets
Stack Horticultural Stations, feed your empire
Build based on current needs, no strong bonuses
Focus on platoon production, support with basic economy

subsections.title: Crew Management
subsections.content: Crew (population) is a hidden constraint on economic growth. Every building and spacecraft requires crew to operate. Managing crew prevents bottlenecks.
subsections.tip: Calculate crew requirements before expanding. A planet with more buildings than crew capacity produces nothing from the overflow.

sections.title: Military Tactics
sections.content: Winning battles is about more than raw strength. These tactical considerations improve your military effectiveness.

subsections.title: Optimal Force Composition
subsections.content: Quality versus quantity is a key decision. Understanding when each approach works helps you build effective forces.

comparison.pros: Fast to produce, expendable, good for defense
comparison.cons: Weak individually, fill platoon limit quickly

comparison.pros: Strong individually, efficient use of platoon limit

subsections.tip: Mix both approaches. Elite platoons for offensive operations, cheaper units for garrison duty.

subsections.title: Aggression Slider Tactics
subsections.content: The aggression slider is a tactical tool, not just a preference setting. Match aggression to the situation.

tactics.reason: End battle quickly, accept losses for speed
Preserve forces, even wins are costly

subsections.title: Attack Timing
subsections.content: When you attack matters as much as how you attack. These timing considerations improve your chances of success.

considerations.timing: Strike after AI commits to non-military buildings
considerations.reason: Their resources are tied up, military weak

considerations.timing: Wait for platoon training to complete (100%)

considerations.reason: AI responds to your fleet movements

considerations.timing: Coordinate attacks to split AI response

sections.title: Common Mistakes
sections.content: Learning from others' mistakes accelerates your improvement. These common errors trap many new players.

subsections.title: Early Game Mistakes
subsections.content: The first 10 turns establish your trajectory. These mistakes can doom your game before it really begins.

mistakes.solution: Build Horticultural Station in first 3 turns
Economic infrastructure first, military after Turn 8-10

mistakes.consequence: Resources spread thin, each planet weak

subsections.title: Combat Mistakes
subsections.content: Even strong armies lose to poor tactics. Avoid these combat errors.

mistakes.consequence: Pyrrhic victory, no forces for follow-up
Orbital Defense bonus defeats close attacks

mistakes.solution: Always garrison Starbase, build Orbital Defense

subsections.title: Strategic Mistakes
subsections.content: These errors compound over many turns, slowly losing you the game.

mistakes.solution: Watch AI actions, anticipate their moves

mistakes.consequence: Crew tied up in useless buildings
mistakes.solution: Scrap buildings that no longer serve your strategy
Resources should flow into productive assets

sections.title: Paths to Victory
sections.content: Victory requires eliminating your opponent, but there are multiple strategic approaches to achieve this goal.

subsections.title: Rush Strategy
subsections.content: Attack early before the opponent establishes defenses. Risky but can end games quickly.
execution: Purchase Battle Cruiser as soon as affordable
Attack by Turn 8-10 with whatever force available
subsections.warning: If the rush fails, you'll be far behind economically. Commit fully or not at all.

subsections.title: Economic Superiority
subsections.content: Build an overwhelming economy, then crush the opponent with superior production.
execution: Heavy investment in Mining and Horticultural Stations
Colonize neutral planets for resource multipliers
Build elite platoons with best equipment
subsections.weakAgainst: None if you survive the early game
subsections.warning: Requires surviving early aggression. Build Orbital Defense on Starbase.

subsections.title: Attrition Warfare
subsections.content: Trade space for time, wearing down the opponent through defensive battles.
execution: Counterattack only when opponent is weakened
Force opponent to attack into fortified positions
subsections.warning: Requires patience. Don't attack until you've ground down their forces.
